text: Atle Jonas Hammer (11 March 1932 – 22 October 2017) was a Norwegian engineer and jazz musician (trumpet, Flugelhorn), central on the jazz scene in Oslo. He was born in Oslo. He was known from several international cooperation.Death date is as per Jan Granlie, Atle Hammer er død (in Norwegian), from salt- peanuts.eu, October 22, 2017. From 1980 to 1985, he led his own quintet with among others Terje Venaas (bass), Eivin Sannes (piano) and Tom Olstad (drumes), and this was followed by a quintet with Harald Bergersen (saxophone), Erling Aksdal (piano, 1985–89). During the 1980s and 1990s he played in bands with Thorgeir Stubø, Per Husby Quintet, Magni Wentzel Quintet, and in Big Bands like the one led by Harald Gundhus/Ole Jacob Hansen and Erling Wicklund's «Storeslem». Hammer died in Oslo on 22 October 2017 at the age of 85. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Civil engineers Category:Norwegian jazz musicians Category:Trumpeters Category:Musicians from Oslo
title: Atle Hammer
